title: Simple & Effective Skincare for Teens & Tweens

steps.title: Wash your face with a gentle cleanser twice a day.
steps.content: Wash your face with a gentle cleanser twice a day. Board-certified dermatologist Dr. Paul Friedman recommends using a gentle cleanser at least twice a day, especially at night to help remove the debris and oil that accumulates on your skin. [1] X Expert Source Paul Friedman, MD Board Certified Dermatologist, American Board of Dermatology Expert Interview. 8 Apr 2020. Just wet your face with lukewarm water, then use your fingertips to apply a gentle cleanser onto your skin. Gently massage your face using circular motions, and then rinse it off and pat your face dry with a clean towel. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Avoid scrubbing your skin, since it can cause irritation. Wash your face once in the morning and once in the evening. Look for cleansers that say “gentle” on the label, and avoid products that contain alcohol. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Use a lightweight, oil-free moisturizer to keep your skin hydrated.
steps.content: Use a lightweight, oil-free moisturizer to keep your skin hydrated. No matter your skin type, moisturizing is an important step to lock in moisture and protect your skin barrier. Apply a nickel-sized amount of a noncomedogenic moisturizer (meaning it won’t clog your pores) right after you wash your face. When your skin is slightly damp, the moisturizer is more effective because it traps water in your skin and keeps it from evaporating. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Be extra careful applying moisturizer around your eye area since the skin is thinner. If you live in a colder climate or have dry skin, you can apply a dime-sized amount of a thicker facial cream or ointment . Most teenagers can use a thinner, water-based moisturizer , but talk to a dermatologist to determine your skin type and what products are best for you.

steps.title: Wear sunscreen with at least SPF 30 daily.
steps.content: Wear sunscreen with at least SPF 30 daily. Everyone needs to apply an SPF 30 sunscreen to protect their skin from ongoing sun damage, says board-certified dermatologist Dr. R. Sonia Batra. [5] X Expert Source R. Sonia Batra, MD, MSc, MPH Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 19 February 2021. As the final step of your morning skincare routine, rub a nickel-sized amount of broad-spectrum, water-resistant sunscreen with an SPF of 30 or higher all over your face. [6] X Research source Be sure to apply sunscreen to dry skin at least 15 minutes before going outside so it fully absorbs, and reapply every 2 hours if you’re outdoors, or after swimming or sweating. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Even if it’s cloudy or you don’t plan to spend a lot of time outdoors, apply sunscreen to protect your skin from harmful UV rays, which can cause skin cancer and premature aging.

steps.title: Apply a non-irritating lip balm several times a day and before bed.
steps.content: Apply a non-irritating lip balm several times a day and before bed. Use a lip balm or ointment to keep your lips plump and hydrated. If you have chapped lips, look for products with castor seed oil, ceramides, dimethicone, hemp seed oil, mineral oil, petroleum, shea butter, or white petroleum jelly. If you’re going outside, apply a lip balm with SPF 30 or higher that contains titanium oxide or zinc oxide. [8] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Carry your lip balm with you so you can reapply it throughout the day. If your lips tingle, burn, or sting after applying lip balm, stop using it and switch to a different product.

steps.title: Use a gentle cream cleanser that’s specifically formulated for acne.
steps.content: Use a gentle cream cleanser that’s specifically formulated for acne. To treat and help prevent breakouts, wash your face with a cleanser that contains salicylic acid or benzoyl peroxide. [9] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Gently massage the cleanser into your skin, then rinse with lukewarm water and pat dry with a clean towel. Wash your face once in the morning and evening, and after sweating or exercising. [10] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Avoid scrubbing or picking your skin, which can cause scarring and worsen active breakouts.

steps.title: Apply a pimple patch or spot treatment directly over your pimples.
steps.content: Apply a pimple patch or spot treatment directly over your pimples. While it’s tempting to pop or squeeze acne, doing so can push bacteria deeper into your skin, increase inflammation, and cause pain and scarring. Instead, board-certified dermatologist Dr. Chloe Goldman recommends using “pimple patches [with] benzoyl peroxide and salicylic acid in them.” [11] X Expert Source Chloe Goldman Board-certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 20 December 2022. These patches can help remove gunk and impurities from your skin without irritating it. Be sure to apply your patch or spot treatment before applying moisturizer. Avoid using products with alcohol, astringents, toners, or exfoliants, which can irritate acne-prone skin. [12] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Batra recommends “a good over-the-counter spot treatment with either a little bit of benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid,” or applying an “ice pack on a really inflamed, juicy pimple…to calm down the inflammation and redness.” [13] X Expert Source R. Sonia Batra, MD, MSc, MPH Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 19 February 2021.

steps.title: Go for an oil-free, gel moisturizer that won’t clog your pores.
steps.content: Go for an oil-free, gel moisturizer that won’t clog your pores. Skincare professional Diana Yerkes recommends using a good moisturizer that’s going to add hydration, because when your skin dries out it produces even more oil to compensate for the fact that you just removed it all. [14] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. Apply the moisturizer twice a day, after washing your face. Even if you have acne-prone skin, apply moisturizer to hydrate your skin, especially if you’re using acne treatments that contain benzoyl peroxide or salicylic acid. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Use noncomedogenic sunscreen, makeup, and skincare products.
steps.content: Use noncomedogenic sunscreen, makeup, and skincare products. These products won’t clog your pores, cause breakouts, or worsen acne. Be sure to apply a noncomedogenic sunscreen with an SPF 30 or higher before going outside. [16] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Avoid sleeping in your makeup or sharing makeup brushes and applicators with other people. This can transfer oil, bacteria, and dead skin cells to your skin and cause breakouts.

steps.title: Wash your face with a gentle cream or foamy cleanser.
steps.content: Wash your face with a gentle cream or foamy cleanser. Using a harsh cleanser can irritate your skin and trigger increased oil production, so look for a mild, gentle face wash that is oil-free and noncomedogenic. [17] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source According to Yerkes, “gentle cream cleansers or gentle foamy cleansers are the best way to clean oily skin.” [18] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. Stick to cleansing twice a day and after sweating. You may be tempted to wash your face more often, but that can actually strip your skin of its natural oils.

steps.title: Apply toner to minimize oil production on your face.
steps.content: Apply toner to minimize oil production on your face. Skincare professional Alicia Ramos says, “toners can work wonders to reduce oil on the surface of the skin.” [19] X Expert Source Alicia Ramos Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 12 June 2019. After cleansing, gently swipe a soothing toner over your face, paying extra attention to oily areas like your T-zone (the forehead, nose, and chin). [20] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Toners also hydrate your skin, make your pores look smaller, and restore your skin’s natural pH balance. Some toners can be irritating, so be sure to perform a patch test on your inner wrist before applying it to your face. [21] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Use an oil-free, noncomedogenic moisturizer to hydrate your skin.
steps.content: Use an oil-free, noncomedogenic moisturizer to hydrate your skin. “Oily skin is often caused by unbalanced, dry skin,” where “your body reacts by creating excess oil and sending it to the surface of [your] skin,” says Ramos. [22] X Expert Source Alicia Ramos Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 12 June 2019. Apply a nickel-sized amount of a lightweight gel moisturizer all over your face to prevent dehydration and regulate oil production. [23] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you have combination skin (where your skin is dry in some places and oily in others), apply a thicker cream or lotion on dry areas and an oil-free gel moisturizer on oily areas.

steps.title: Try a powder sunscreen to absorb excess oil and protect your skin.
steps.content: Try a powder sunscreen to absorb excess oil and protect your skin. To avoid layering lots of cream products all over your face, Yerkes recommends “using a powder sunscreen ” if you have oily skin. She loves the Colorscience Brush-On Sunscreen because it’s easy to apply and “protects your skin from sun damage and sun exposure.” [24] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. If you want to apply a cream, look for an oil-free, fragrance-free sunscreen that contains zinc oxide or titanium oxide . [25] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Apply a yeast or mud mask to your face twice a week.
steps.content: Apply a yeast or mud mask to your face twice a week. According to Yerkes, “oily skin needs to be treated with masks more frequently.” She recommends mud masks and Brewer’s Yeast masks because they improve your skin texture without drying it out.” [26] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019. Just follow the directions on your specific face mask and rinse it off with lukewarm water after it dries. Look for face masks that are fragrance-free, hypoallergenic, and free of dyes and parabens. [27] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Yerkes says not to use face masks “more than 2 times a week” because they can dry out your skin and lead to excess oil production. [28] X Expert Source Diana Yerkes Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 16 April 2019.

steps.title: Wash your face with a gentle, fragrance-free cleanser.
steps.content: Wash your face with a gentle, fragrance-free cleanser. Apply enough cleanser to remove dirt and oil from your face, but avoid using so much that you see a thick lather or foam—this can strip your skin and remove healthy oils. [29] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Gently massage the cleanser into your skin, then rinse off with lukewarm water. Stay away from hot water when showering or washing your face—it can dry out your skin. [30] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you have super dry skin, you can get away with cleansing your face once a day, in the evening. [31] X Research source

steps.title: Select a thicker moisturizer to heal and hydrate your skin.
steps.content: Select a thicker moisturizer to heal and hydrate your skin. To treat dry, flaky, or scaly skin, apply a dime-sized dollop of cream or ointment all over your face, immediately after cleansing to lock in moisture. Look for hydrating ingredients like jojoba oil, dimethicone, glycerine, hyaluronic acid, lactic acid, lanolin, and shea butter. [32] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Avoid using skincare products that contain fragrance, alcohol, or retinoids. For extremely dry and irritated skin, choose a moisturizer that contains oil, with ingredients like petroleum jelly or mineral oil. Apply it to your skin as often as needed. [33] X Trustworthy Source National Eczema Association Nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of those with eczema through research and education Go to source

steps.title: Use a hypoallergenic, fragrance-free cleanser that boosts your skin barrier.
steps.content: Use a hypoallergenic, fragrance-free cleanser that boosts your skin barrier. It’s best to avoid cleansers with dyes, fragrances, or other harsh ingredients, because they can cause redness, itchiness, burning, and dryness. [34] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Choose a cleanser with a short ingredient list, and avoid scrubbing your skin or using hot water. [35] X Research source Some great options include the Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser or the La Roche-Posay Toleriane Hydrating Gentle Face Cleanser .

steps.title: Apply a hypoallergenic, fragrance-free moisturizer with soothing ingredients.
steps.content: Apply a hypoallergenic, fragrance-free moisturizer with soothing ingredients. Sensitive skin may sting or burn after applying certain products, so you have to be extra careful about what you apply. [36] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Stick with a barrier-boosting moisturizer with ingredients such as ceramides, petroleum, glycerin, and hyaluronic acid. [37] X Research source “Ceramide is a protein that helps hold onto water and helps the water stay deeper in the skin barrier,” says Board-certified dermatologist Dr. Mohiba Tareen. [38] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020.

steps.title: Cleanse your face, back, and chest after sweating.
steps.content: Cleanse your face, back, and chest after sweating. Sweat can push impurities out of your pores, but it can also cause breakouts if you don’t wash your skin. Use a cleanser and body wash with salicylic acid or benzoyl peroxide to fight bacteria and prevent acne. [39] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Shower or wash your skin as soon as you can after exercising. Be sure to wash your sports equipment regularly, too. This includes helmets, hats, jerseys, and sweatbands.

steps.title: Eat a healthy diet and drink enough water.
steps.content: Eat a healthy diet and drink enough water. According to Tareen, “good nutrition…and hydration [are] key to keeping your skin supple and elastic.” [40] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020. Be sure to consume lots of fruit, vegetables, whole grains, and lean protein, and drink 6-8 glasses of water daily to keep your skin hydrated. [41] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Avoid eating processed and refined foods that are high in sugar, since they can cause skin inflammation and breakouts.

steps.title: Get at least 8 hours of sleep every day.
steps.content: Get at least 8 hours of sleep every day. When you sleep, your skin goes into repair mode, allowing your body to regenerate the cells that make you look refreshed and revitalized. People who don’t get enough sleep have more noticeable signs of aging, especially when it comes to skin tone and texture. [42] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source Aim for 8-10 hours of quality sleep to help your skin look amazing! Tareen says, “It is very important to establish [good sleeping] habits at a young age. What you do as a child…impacts greatly what your skin will look and feel like later on.” [43] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020.

steps.title: Stick to a consistent skincare routine.
steps.content: Stick to a consistent skincare routine. According to Ramos, “consistency is key” to keep your skin beautiful over time. [44] X Expert Source Alicia Ramos Skincare Professional Expert Interview. 12 June 2019. Plan to cleanse, moisturize, and apply sunscreen every morning, then cleanse and moisturize every evening to remove sunscreen, dirt, and grime. In general, it takes about 4 months to see a noticeable change in your skin. [45] X Research source If you have acne-prone skin, trying a new treatment every week can irritate your skin and cause breakouts. It’s important to give a new product about 6-8 weeks to see results.

steps.title: Touch your face as little as possible.
steps.content: Touch your face as little as possible. Touching your face can spread oil, dirt, and bacteria from your hands to your face, which can cause pimples and worsen existing acne. Only touch your face when you’re doing your skincare routine, after you’ve washed your hands with soap and water. [46] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: When should you see a dermatologist?
steps.content: When should you see a dermatologist? If your skin doesn’t respond to at-home treatments or lifestyle changes within 1-2 months, make an appointment with your dermatologist. They can help you identify the root cause of your skin issues and give you a personalized treatment plan. Some skin concerns, such as acne and scarring, may require prescription medication. [47] X Research source

steps.title: Is there a problem with having a complicated skincare routine?
steps.content: Is there a problem with having a complicated skincare routine? Yes, overdoing your skincare at an early age can cause issues. Some skincare formulas are not appropriate for teens, and they can damage the skin barrier (which isn’t fully formed in pre-teens), increase the skin’s sun sensitivity, and cause breakouts. [48] X Research source A simple skincare routine of gentle cleansing, moisturizing, and applying sunscreen is enough for teens.

steps.title: Is CeraVe good for teens?
steps.content: Is CeraVe good for teens? Yes, CeraVe is suitable for teens, especially if they have sensitive or acne-prone skin. Most of their products are noncomedogenic and feature gentle ingredients, such as hyaluronic acid and ceramides. In fact, CeraVe is one of the few skincare brands that is universally recommended by dermatologists! [49] X Research source
